content: Here is a fine example of what is wrong with the Republican Party. First the distortion of facts, either from being ill informed or by exaggerating the story: “Why a 150 ton flying limousine that take 20-30,000 pound of fuel just to get to altitude???” The Obama's did not take the jumbo jet commonly thought of as the president's plane. Instead, they flew in an Air Force Gulfstream V (C-37A) for their flight to NYC, it's a 12 passenger aircraft. Next the made up statistics. “and in the process burned more fuel in one 24 hour period than I or my whole family will use in a LIFE TIME!!” Which allows for great anger. “What a %$@#%$ hypocrite!!” Obama critics think that everyone else is as angry as they are – but they are not. People are looking for leadership to offer real solutions to real problems. All that the Republicans and conservatives come up with is tax cuts, opposition and pettiness. America is a right of center country. But the Republicans have marginalized themselves, and that does not seem to be changing.

content: Here is a fine example of what is wrong with the Republican Party. Instead, they flew in an Air Force Gulfstream V (C-37A) for their flight to NYC, it's a 12 passenger aircraft. People are looking for leadership to offer real solutions to real problems. All that the Republicans and conservatives come up with is tax cuts, opposition and pettiness. America is a right of center country. But the Republicans have marginalized themselves, and that does not seem to be changing.

Dressed in a dark suit and royal-blue tie, Bush was greeted on the airport tarmac by a delegation that included Los Angeles County Supervisor Michael Antonovich, Sheriff Lee Baca, Arcadia Mayor Roger Chandler, actor Bruce Boxleitner and retired Air Force Col. Paul Gill." If you are angry about the President's trip to NYC, it is because you just want to be angry about whatever the President does. Quite a difference....taking time out to commend fire-fighters v. date night in NYC... Who's angry? I just enjoy pointing out the hypocrisy.
